title: Evaluating functions
text: Given the equation for a function, we should replace the input variable in the equation with the value provided and then calculate the result.
speech: Given the equation for a function, we should replace the input variable in the equation with the value provided and then calculate the result.

title: Replacement
text: Replace the variable $$x$$ with $$-3$$, and we get $$f(-3)=\sqrt{2-\left(-3\right)}+5$$.
speech: Replace the variable  x  with  negative 3 , and we get  f of negative 3 is equal to the square root of 2 minus negative 3 end root plus 5 .
pacedSpeech: , and we get   f of negative 3 is equal to the square root of 2 minus negative 3 end root plus 5

title: Calculation
text: Calculate the expression $$\sqrt{2-\left(-3\right)}+5$$. What do you get?
speech: Calculate the expression  the square root of 2 minus negative 3 end root plus 5 . What do you get?
